an8.55:4.1: Then Ujjaya the brahmin went up to the Buddha,
an8.55:4.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
an8.55:4.5: “Master Gotama, we wish to travel abroad.
an8.55:4.6: May the Buddha please teach us the Dharma in a way that leads to our welfare and happiness in this life and in future lives.”
an8.55:5.1: “Brahmin, these four things lead to the happiness and welfare of a respectable person in this life.
an8.55:5.3: Accomplishment in initiative, protection, good friendship, and balanced finances.
an8.55:6.1: And what is accomplishment in initiative?
an8.55:6.2: A respectable person may earn a living by means such as
an8.55:6.3: farming, trade, raising cattle, archery, government service, or one of the crafts.
an8.55:6.4: They understand how to go about these things in order to complete and organize the work.
an8.55:6.5: This is called accomplishment in initiative.
an8.55:7.1: And what is accomplishment in protection?
an8.55:7.2: It’s when a respectable person owns legitimate wealth that he’s earned by his own efforts and initiative, built up with his own hands, gathered by the sweat of the brow.
an8.55:7.3: They ensure it is guarded and protected, thinking:
an8.55:7.4: ‘How can I prevent this wealth from being taken by rulers or bandits, consumed by fire, swept away by flood, or taken by unloved heirs?’
an8.55:7.5: This is called accomplishment in protection.
an8.55:8.1: And what is accomplishment in good friendship?
an8.55:8.2: It’s when a respectable person resides in a town or village.
an8.55:8.3: And in that place there are householders or their children who may be young or old, but are mature in conduct, accomplished in faith, ethics, generosity, and wisdom.
an8.55:8.4: That person associates with them, converses, and engages in discussion.
an8.55:8.5: And they emulate the same kind of accomplishment in faith, ethics, generosity, and wisdom.
an8.55:8.6: This is called accomplishment in good friendship.
an8.55:9.1: And what is accomplishment in balanced finances?
an8.55:9.2: It’s when a respectable person, knowing their income and expenditure, balances their finances, being neither too extravagant nor too frugal. They think:
an8.55:9.3: ‘In this way my income will exceed my expenditure, not the reverse.’
an8.55:9.4: It’s like an appraiser or their apprentice who, holding up the scales, knows that
an8.55:9.5: it’s low by this much or high by this much.
an8.55:9.6: In the same way, a respectable person, knowing their income and expenditure, balances their finances, being neither too extravagant nor too frugal. They think:
an8.55:9.7: ‘In this way my income will exceed my expenditure, not the reverse.’
an8.55:9.8: If a respectable person has little income but an opulent life, people will say:
an8.55:9.9: ‘This respectable person eats their wealth like a fig-eater!’
an8.55:9.10: If a respectable person has a large income but a spartan life, people will say:
an8.55:9.11: ‘This respectable person is starving themselves to death!’
an8.55:9.12: But a respectable person, knowing their income and expenditure, leads a balanced life, neither too extravagant nor too frugal, thinking:
an8.55:9.13: ‘In this way my income will exceed my expenditure, not the reverse.’ This is called accomplishment in balanced finances.
an8.55:10.1: There are four causes of loss for wealth that has been gathered in this way.
an8.55:10.2: Womanizing, drinking, gambling, and having bad friends, companions, and associates.
an8.55:10.3: Suppose there was a large reservoir with four inlets and four outlets.
an8.55:10.4: And someone was to open up the outlets and close off the inlets,
an8.55:10.5: and the heavens don’t provide enough rain.
an8.55:10.6: You’d expect that large reservoir to dwindle, not expand.
an8.55:10.7: In the same way, there are four causes of loss for wealth that has been gathered in this way.
an8.55:10.8: Womanizing, drinking, gambling, and having bad friends, companions, and associates.
an8.55:11.1: There are four causes of growth for wealth that has been gathered in this way.
an8.55:11.2: Not womanizing, drinking, or gambling, and having good friends, companions, and associates.
an8.55:11.3: Suppose there was a large reservoir with four inlets and four outlets.
an8.55:11.4: And someone was to open up the outlets and close off the inlets,
an8.55:11.5: and the heavens provide plenty of rain.
an8.55:11.6: You’d expect that large reservoir to expand, not dwindle.
an8.55:11.7: In the same way, there are four causes of growth for wealth that has been gathered in this way.
an8.55:11.8: Not womanizing, drinking, or gambling, and having good friends, companions, and associates.
an8.55:12.1: These are the four things that lead to the happiness and welfare of a respectable person in this life.
an8.55:13.1: These four things lead to the happiness and welfare of a respectable person in future lives.
an8.55:13.3: Accomplishment in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
an8.55:13.4: And what is accomplishment in faith?
an8.55:13.5: It’s when a noble disciple has faith in the Realized One’s awakening:
an8.55:13.6: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme trainer of people,
an8.55:13.7: teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
an8.55:13.8: This is called accomplishment in faith.
an8.55:14.1: And what is accomplishment in ethics?
an8.55:14.2: It’s when someone doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie,
an8.55:14.3: or consume alcohol and drugs, which cause negligence.
an8.55:14.4: This is called accomplishment in ethics.
an8.55:15.1: And what is accomplishment in generosity?
an8.55:15.2: It’s when a respectable person lives at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.
an8.55:15.3: This is called accomplishment in generosity.
an8.55:16.1: And what is accomplishment in wisdom?
an8.55:16.2: It’s when a respectable person is wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
an8.55:16.4: This is called accomplishment in wisdom.
an8.55:17.1: These are the four things that lead to the happiness and welfare of a respectable person in future lives.”
an8.55:19.4: to well-being in lives to come.
an8.55:20.3: are declared by the one who is truly named
an8.55:20.4: to lead to happiness in both spheres,
an8.55:21.1: welfare and benefit in this life,
an8.55:21.3: This is how, for a householder,
